While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods.

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulam is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and six children in a house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Oyungerel, age 51, works in dry cleaning. Two daughters work at local grocery stores as saleswomen, and her son works at a construction site. Daughters Zolzaya, age 23, and Odtuya, age 21, are university students, and Alimaa, age 18, is a senior student at a local high school. 

She has been running her organic dairy products business in a rental counter of a local market since 2004. She had started her business in 2002 as a grocery store. She has gained a lot of experience over the years and paid off her children's university tuition from her profit. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of organic milk to produce organic dairy products and attend the province's organic dairy products fair. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk to produce organic dairy products and attend the province's organic dairy products fair.

loans.name: Gino

texts.es: Gino de 24 años , está casado y tiene un hijo de apenas un año de edad,él vive en casa de sus padres a lado de su esposa y sus hermanos. Gino se dedica a la edición de audio y video para conocidos programas televisivos y radiales de la región, además de alquilar su equipo de sonido y algunos otros implementos para fiestas y eventos sociales de la ciudad, parte de su trabajo consiste en realizar comerciales, sesiones fotográficas, narrar algunos documentales, etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en la casa de su mamá, ya que ahi cuenta con una pequeña oficina. Lleva 3 años en éste negocio, siente que le va muy bien ya que su clientela se ha multiplicado.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos además de que se divierte haciendo esto ya que es algo que le fascina desde muy niño, durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta actividad aprendió muchas cosas y continuamente está capacitándose en nuevas técnicas de sonido y diseño. Su meta principal es poner un estudio de sonido totalmente implementado, por lo pronto va comprando poco a poco algunos instrumentos que son necesarios para su trabajo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles con este monto comprará algunos cables que necesita renovar, realizará la reparación de un parlante y comprará focos de luces a colores que necesita para alquilarlos.
texts.en: Gino is 24 years old.  He is married and has a son who is just one year old.  Gino lives alongside his wife and siblings in his parents' house.  He makes a living editing audio and video tracks for television and radio programs that are well-known in the region.  In addition he rents out his sound and some other equipment for festivals and social events in the city.  Part of his work consists of making adverts, photo shoots, narrating documentaries, and such like.  He does this work at his mother's house as there he has a small office.  He has had this business for three years and feels it is going well as the number of customers has multiplied.  What Gino likes about his work is that he is making a good income and that he has fun doing it - this type of work is something that has fascinated him since he was a boy.  In the time that he has been doing this work, Gino has learned many things and he is continually training himself to use new sound and design technology.  His main goal is to have a fully equipped recording studio.  In the meantime he is buying some of the tools that he needs for his work, little by little.  On this occasion he is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles.  With this money he will buy new cables that he needs to update, he will repair a speaker and buy coloured light bulbs that he needs for renting out.

loans.use: to buy cables and repair music equipment.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 61 years old and married with seven children. Conchita works very hard to provide for them.

Conchita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is 32 years old, married and has one child who is in school.  

Lorelyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lorelyn requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase addtional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorelyn has been pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase addtional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbold is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife, Tsend-Ayush, age 50, helps her husband to run his wooden furniture manufacturing business, and she works as painter. His daughter, Dondmaa, age 23, and son, Enhbaatar, age 22, study at university. 

He has been manufacturing wooden furniture on their plot of land. He built a non-insulated workplace on their land, and now he is planning to insulate it to be able to work four seasons of the year. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase insulation material and inventory for his newly built workplace. He is a hardworking and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and inventory for his newly built workplace.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica de 23 años ,está casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, ella vive al lado de ellos en la casa de sus suegros. Jessica se dedica a la venta de comida. Su trabajo se inicia desde muy temprano ya que todos los días se dirige al mercado a comprar los ingredientes necesarios para preparar los más ricos platillos . Prepara todos los potajes durante el transcurso del día y su horario de atención empieza a las 5 de la tarde y termina muy entrada la noche . Trabaja sola y lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 3 años.Le gusta su trabajo por que puede dedicarle el tiempo y la atención necesaria a sus hijos que son aun pequeños y necesitan de su cuidado, durante el tiempo que tiene trabajando en éste negocio, aprendió a brindarle siempre una sonrisa al cliente y darle una buena atención, pues eso hace que vuelvan a su puesto y de esta forma conserva su clientela. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora e implementar su negocio con más mesas y sillas hasta conseguir un establecimiento más grande.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de una mesa y 4 sillas cuyo precio promedio es 100 soles, otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes e insumos como pollos, carnes, papas, aceites y embutidos . Además se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que esta recibiendo ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en: Jessica is 23 years old.  She is married and has two young children.  She lives alongside them in her in-laws' house.  Jessica makes a living selling food.  She starts very early as every day she goes to the market to buy the necessary ingredients to make the most delicious dishes.  She prepares all the stews throughout the day and starts serving customers at 5pm.  She finishes late at night.  She works alone and has been doing this for three years.  Jessica likes her work because she can spend time with her children and give them the necessary attention.  They are still young and need her to look after them.  In the time that she has been working, Jessica has learned always to give her customers a smile and good service as this is what makes them return to her and so she keeps customers.  She hopes to continue with this work and expand with more chairs and seats, and even look for larger premises.  On this occasion she is applying for 2000 Nuevo Soles for a table and four chairs, which sell for about 100 Nuevo Soles.  The rest of the money will be used to buy ingredients and supplies such as chicken, meat, potatoes, oil and sausage.  She is very content with the financial support that she receives as it will help her to progress to with her business.

loans.use: to buy a table and chairs and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita, de 27 años, es una mujer alegre y esta casada con Juan ,con quien tiene tres hijos , es por ellos por quienes trabaja ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Juanita consiste la venta de diversas golosinas por esta razón tiene un puesto de venta instalado en la vereda de su hogar. Considera que tiene un negocio muy rentable ya que tiene una buena fluidez de clientela . Lleva con la misma rutina de trabajo cerca de 10 años y desde que empezó a ejecutarlo lo ha hecho siempre sola. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que siempre le ha fascinado estar en contacto con los clientes, afirma que ha sido muy complicado para ella poder establecer su pequeño negocio ya que anteriormente vendía prendas de vestir pero no le pagaban a tiempo y eso le daba cierto temor de emprender otro negocio, a pesar de ello nunca se rindió y hoy tiene muchos planes con su actual negocio , por el momento solo desea incrementar su capital .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará galletas, caramelos, chocolates, chicles, chizitos, chupetes y otras golosinas para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en: Twenty-seven year old Juanita is happy and married to Juan.  They have three children together and it is for them that they work as they want to provide them with a better quality of life.  Juanita's work consists of selling various sweets so she has stall on the pavement outside her house.  She thinks her business is very profitable as she has a regular stream of customers.  She has had the same working routing for nearly ten years and she always worked alone.  Juanita likes her work a lot as she enjoys the contact with customers.  She says it has been very complicated for her to establish her small business and before she sold clothes but customers did not pay on time.  This scared her a little when thinking about starting this new business.  In spite of this, Juanita never gave up and she now has many plans for her business.  For now she just wants to increase her capital.  On this occasion she is applying for 500 Nuevo Soles and she is grateful to all those who make this loan possible for her to continue with her objectives.  At the same time she promises to be prompt and responsible on repaying her loans.  With the loan she will buy biscuits, sweets, chocolate, chewing gum, cheese puffs, lollipops and other sweets so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. Merly is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Merly requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Merly has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items (e.g, soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, groceries, etc.) for her general store.

loans.name: 12 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres 12 de Diciembre es de la Ciudad de Santaní, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y están trabajando para poder seguir creciendo.  Son mujeres jefas de familia, que desean poder ayudar a sus familias y así darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Este comité es un grupo muy unido y capaz de desarrollar actividades que fortalezcan la economía de su vivienda y del grupo.
La Señora Benjamina, una de las miembros, vende productos de limpieza que ella prepara semanalmente en el centro de la ciudad, así también vende los productos agrícolas producidos por su marido y de esa forma ambos se ayudan por salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de una microfranquicia de limpieza, que tiene los productos que ella necesita para hacer sus productos de limpieza y de esa forma seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women named “12 de Diciembre” (December 12th) is in the city of Santaní. The members are in their second loan cycle and are working so that they can continue to grow. These women are the heads of their families and they want to help them. In order to do this, they are giving their best so their families do not feel deprived. This committee is a unified and capable group that has developed in activities that strengthen their financial standing in their homes and as a group.

Sra. Benjamina is one of the members. She sells cleaning products that she prepares weekly in the central part of the city. Benjamina also sells farm products that are grown by her husband. Both business activities enable her to move forward and help her family get ahead.

Benjamina is requesting a loan in order to buy a cleaning franchise so that she can have the resources that she needs to make cleaning products. As a result, she will be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a cleaning franchise for making cleaning products.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Cathérine est une femme de 50 ans mariée mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate, fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un camion des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Cathérine, age 50, is married and the mother of a family. For about fifteen years, she's been a merchant who retails fresh products (tomatoes, fruits) depending on the season in one of her town's markets.

She has a good knowledge of the producers and of her clientele, which she acquired over time thanks to her experience in this field.

Nevertheless, she's constantly out of stock because she's forced to sell everything before being able to buy new products, due to her small working capital.

She would like to buy a truckload of plantains in order to have a large stock, which will enable her to better meet a constant customer demand and avoid getting out of stock.

She will save her profits, not only to expand her business, but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old, and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anita has a general store in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, detergent, sardines and other groceries.

Anita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Anita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, detergent, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en: Sangita is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children ages 3 and 1. In 2010, she established her grocery store. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future Sangita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger quantities, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her pasal (small grocery store).

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 piglets and to build a pig stall.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Raquel has been in this business for 3 years. Raquel earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable to sell in her market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and corn in bulk to sell at her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Zay

texts.en: Mr. Zay is 37 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a house in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Narantsetseg, age 41, helps her husband to run their traditional boots manufacturing business at home. His son Anhbayar, age 20,  stays home and helps with his parents' business, Suh-Ochir, age 14, and daughter Dagiisuren, age 7, go to a local school. Zay started his traditional boots manufacturing business in 1992. They sell their boots to retailers of big markets and produce around 35-40 pairs of boots per month. Mr. Zay needs 2,000,000MNT to purchase inventory now before the lunar new year when the prices are at a minimum. The borrower and his wife are hardworking, open-minded and modest people.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his shoe manufacturing business before the lunar new year while prices are at their minimum.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 27 years old. Thelma is married and has 2 children who are in school.
Thelma is raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.
Thelma has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 50 años de edad, esta casada hace 19 años con Antonio y junto a él tiene 3 hijos , Juntos viven en la casa de material novel que ellos construyeron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de comidas típicas de la región y asados de carne , para ello se instala en el frontis de su casa, desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la tarde. Lleva en este negocio 5 meses y trabaja sola.Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades diarias que requiere la crianza de sus hijos, por lo contrario no le gusta cuando el precio de los insumos que utiliza suben repentinamente reduciendo sus ganancias, pero aun así logra encontrar la rentabilidad en sus ventas, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio ampliándolo con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800 soles, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará todos los ingredientes  al por mayor  tales como arroz, aceites, papas y otros para así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: 50 year old Isabel has been married to Antonio for 19 years and, together with him, she has 3 children. They live together in a house made of new materials that they built with great effort. Isabel works selling the typical food of the region and roast meats. She does this in the front part of her house, from where she can attend to her customers in a kind and cordial way. She works every day until 6 at night. She has been running this business for 5 months and works alone. She likes her business as it permits her to have an income with which to cover the household expenses and the daily needs for bringing up her children. On the other hand, she doesn't like it when the cost of the supplies that she uses rises all of a sudden, reducing her income. However, even when this happens, she has been able to keep her sales profitable. She has plans to continue with her business, growing it by having more chairs and tables to offer her customers greater comfort. On this occasion, she is requesting $700. She is grateful for the financial support that she is being offered to continue with her business and move her plans forward. With the money she is requesting, she will buy all the ingredients in bulk, for instance rice, oils, potatoes, and other things so that she can get the best profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including rice and potatoes.

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en: Mr. Ochirbat is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Narantuya, age 47, runs their family business of traditional boot manufacturing together with her husband. His son, Lhagvadorj, age 21, works for a local private company and Ochirdorj, age 19, is a freshman at an engineering university. The borrower has been running his traditional boot manufacturing business at home since 1997. He has already built close relationships with customers and suppliers. He is now requesting 1,000,000 tugriks to purchase leather inventory before the lunar new year when the price of inventory falls to the minimum. He is a hardworking, responsible and trustful man.

loans.use: to purchase leather inventory to manufacture traditional boots before the lunar new year.

loans.name: Meredith

texts.en: Meredith is 44 years old and has three children. Meredith is married and has one child who is in school. She is in an agricultural business, buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. Meredith requested a 30,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell. Meredith has been buying and selling pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Meredith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, es madre de tres hijos de 20, 14 y 10 años respectivamente a quienes educa y cría con la finalidad de hacerlos personas de bien para la sociedad, ella está casada y tiene su casa propia .El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, entre los productos que vende destacan los que son usados en aseo y cuidado personal, tratamiento facial, colonias, perfumes, algunas joyas, ropa y otros. Todo su trabajo lo realiza en su casa o por las calles de la ciudad ya que los ofrece entre sus amigos y conocidos .Se inició en este trabajo hace 4 años le era complicado poder realizarlo con éxito ya que no sabía muy bien como lograr obtener a sus clientes, pero con el tiempo fue aprendiendo y capacitándose con técnicas de ventas, así pudo salir adelante y logró consolidarse como una vendedora exitosa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer otras actividades que desee, además de brindarle también la atención necesaria a sus hijos, le está yendo muy bien ya que los ingresos que percibe le permiten proyectarse con planes a futuro, pero lo que desea por ahora es seguir creciendo y aumentar la variedad de productos  para que así sus ganancias se multipliquen.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles para comprar un lote de perfumes, joyas, ropa y accesorios que le permitirán tener a su negocio con mayor clientela, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en: 41 year old María is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is the mother of 3 children, who are 20, 14, and 10 years old respectively. She is bringing them up with the ultimate goal of having them be valuable members of society. She is married and has her own home. María works selling beauty products and, amongst the products that she sells, those that are used for personal cleanliness and care stand out: facial treatments, perfumes, some jewelry, clothes, and other things. She does all her work in her house or in the streets of her city as she sells her goods to her friends and people she knows. She began this work 4 years ago and it was difficult for her to start well as she didn't know very well how to get clients. But, with time, she learned and taught herself sales methods. In this way, she was able to get ahead and offer her children the attention that they need. The business is doing very well and the income allows her to make plans for the future. However, what she wants now is to keep growing the business and increasing the variety of products that she sells so that her profits will increase. At this time, she is requesting $200 to buy a batch of perfumes, jewelry, clothes, and accessories that will enable her to have more customers for her business. She is very happy to know that she has financial support as this makes her feel more secure in building her business. What's more, she promises again to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Fátima se encuentra en el 1º ciclo y esta integrado por 10 señoras de la ciudad de Santaní. Este comité es un grupo muy unido y capaz de desarrollar actividades que fortalezcan la economía de sus viviendas y del grupo.
La señora Irene se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, el crédito que solicita lo quiere invertir en la compra de animales, como ser gallinas, patos, etc. Irene dice que gracias a su trabajo puede ir mejorando su economía e ir creciendo como microempresaria. Su sueño es poder tener mucha cantidad de animales y así poder tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima committee is in its first loan cycle and is composed of 10 women from the city of Santaní. The group is very united and capable of developing activities that support the members’ household economy.

Irene raises and sells animals. She is requesting a loan to invest in animals, such as chickens, ducks, etc. Irene says that thanks to this work, she can improve her home economy and grow as a small business owner. Her dream is to have a large number of animals and be able to earn a better income.

loans.use: purchase farmyard animals to sell

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 53 years old, maried and has nine children. 

Demetria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Demetria has been raising pigs for five years now, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Demetria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Demetria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 39 years old, is married and has five grown children. Susan is a woman with full of determination and love of her family. Her husband works as farmer.

She is engaged in selling different products within the community. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, spices, sugar, cooking oil and drinks for her store. She is dreaming that someday she can build her own stall in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, sugar, cooking oil and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Mwanajuma's Group

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a 57-year-old mother of nine. To earn income for her family, she sells uniforms to local schools but faces the challenge of customer inconsistency. Mwanajuma is also a volunteer community health worker. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, as she says, "I have some land and I feel I want to do what KOMAZA is doing and be a part of KOMAZA in planting trees." With the profits from her tree farm, Mwanajuma plans to build a good house for her family, install electricity and piped water, and build a water storage tank. Her favorite part of the KOMAZA microforestry program is "seeing from my neighbors that the trees are doing well and learning how to plant trees." Also pictured with the group of three is Kuvuna, who is a cosigner for Nyevu's tree farm.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 63 años,está casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su último hijo en la casa que construyeron hace muchos años como producto de su trabajo . Mercedes es dueña de una bodega que está ubicada en su hogar, vende todo tipo de abarrotes y gaseosas de las mejores marcas , tiene muchos clientes ya que es la única bodega de  la zona . Lleva ya en éste negocio 25 años y cuenta con la ayuda eventual de su esposo en la atención mientras que su hijo genera ingresos adicionales con otro trabajo. Recuerda que cuando empezó con esta actividad no tenia muchos conocimientos de cómo llevar a cabo esta función, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora es una experta vendedora .Le agrada su trabajo por que está en contacto con la gente y así no se siente sola cuando su esposo e hijo salen a trabajar, además le genera buenos ingresos debido a las elevadas ventas que tiene a diario.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 soles para comprar algunos abarrotes de mayor consumo como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite leche, gaseosas, panes, embutidos y otros productos que ofrece en su tienda a su vez se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que esta recibiendo ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio .
texts.en: 63 year old Mercedes is married and lives with her husband and their youngest child in the house that they built many years ago as a result of her work. Mercedes is the proprietor of a grocery store which is located in her home. She sells all sorts of groceries and sodas of the best brands. She has many customers as it is the only grocery store in the area.  She has been running this business for 25 years and has help from her husband and her son brings in income from other work. She remembers that, when she began this business, she didn't have much of an idea of how to do it. But, with time, she learned and know she is an excellent sales person. She likes her work because she gets lots of contact with people and so she doesn't feel lonely when her husband and son leave for work. In addition, she makes good profits because of the high sales that she has every day. At this time, she is requesting $975 to buy some staple groceries such as rice, sugar, eggs, oil, milk, sodas, bread, sausages, and other products that she offers in her store. For her part, she feels happy about the financial support that she is receiving as it enables her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 67-years-old and married with four children. He works very hard to provide for them.

Roberto runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Roberto has been in this business for six years and sells shampoo, canned goods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Roberto would like to build and expand his business to support the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, a 30-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for six years, and also earns an income from fishing.

Teresita, who has received and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF, is now requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to purchase more stocks to sell such as coffee, sugar, bread, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell such as coffee, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Analfe

texts.en: Analfe is a 22-year-old married woman who has two children. She lives in a small home with her husband. She has a retail business, which has been a profitable project. She is applying for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy soap, toothpaste, shampoo and detergents to sell in her business. This purchase will enable her to provide better quality service to her loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Analfe's income.

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste, shampoo and detergents to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, a mother of seven children, is 59 years old and a widow residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province.  

To sustain her living, she grows rice on two hectares of leased farmland. This is a business that she just became involved in one year ago. 

Mao, a seven-time borrower, has formed a group with a fifth-time borrower. Each of them is seeking 176,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy necessary materials to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to own a proper latrine to improve the health of the family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a computer shop in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional computers for this business. 

Julie has been in this business for 1 year. She earns additional income from a general store.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Devorah

texts.en:
Ma. Devorah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Devorah requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Devorah has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Ma. Devorah would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To generate income, Jean is engaged in the hog-raising business. She has been in this business for almost three years. She usually earns about PHP 2,500 per piglet. She is applying for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins so her hogs will grow properly.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins so her hogs will grow properly.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia is one of the members who has a housing loan from the city of San Pedro de Macoris. This is her eighth loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her clothing and cosmetic sales business for over five years. With her last loan, she invested in her business, where she sells cosmetic and other miscellaneous products. Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown fidelity to their groups. The program allows them to take out loans to improve the structure of their houses, while running their businesses and attending their group meetings. Silvia is the mother of four children, and they live with her and her long-term partner. She works and lives in a rural town in San Pedro de Macoris. She will use this loan to buy cement for her walls and tiles for her kitchen, and to add iron gates to her balcony. She thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy building materials for walls, tiles for the kitchen and iron for gates, to improve her house as she runs her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta, from San Pedro Province in Isabela, is  married to Rogelio. She is a vendor. She explains that she has loyal customers because she always provides good service. She is a hard-working person, responsible and very honest. Her dream is to have her own store. With time, sacrifice and hard work, she was able to reach her goal. She is now applying for a loan to expand her business. In this way, she expects to be able to continue to grow her business and to offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, cabbages and squash for her business.

loans.name: Sada's Group

texts.en:
Sada, age 29, is a small-scale dry-lands farmer. She and her husband, who is also a farmer, have eight children, seven of whom are enrolled in school. In the picture, Saba is shown with her hand raised.

Dada is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she likes the concept of planting trees for income generation. With the proceeds from her tree farm, Sada says, "I am planning to send my young kids to university and improve my life standard." She also wants to build a house and install electricity in her home. 

She has some additional business ideas as well, including using her tree farm profits to buy a dairy cow or open a shop.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana has a housing loan from the city of San Pedro de Macoris. This is her 11th loan, which she will use to improve her house. 

She has had her miscellaneous sales business for over six years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. With her last loan, she invested in her business, where she sells cosmetic and other miscellaneous products.

Susana is the mother of five children and they live together with her and her long-term partner. She works and lives in a rural town in San Pedro de Macoris. She will use this loan to buy cement, concrete blocks for her wall and other construction materials to build her roof.

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time running their business and attending their group meetings.

Susana thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a zinc roof and concrete block wall.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo, age 36, and his wife Felicia have been tending to a two-acre cacao farm for ten years now. They have brought up three children, two of which are currently in school. The kids and wife help Pablo out on the farm during peak harvest season, which for cacao picks up in January to May. To harvest cacao, farmers use a hook knife or machete to cut the fruit off the trunk. Once the pod is cracked open the sweet pulp surrounding cacao beans starts fermenting and needs to be put into wooden boxes for fermentation. 

Pablo was inspired to start farming cacao because of the stable market access and an attractive price. He saw it as an opportunity because cacao is a permanent crop and will start producing pods after about four years and continue for decades thereafter. Apart from cacao, the family also plants corn and beans for home use.

The favorite part of cacao farming for Pablo is harvesting because it does not require a lot of work. The challenging part, however, is cleaning because it requires a lot of time, and besides farming Pablo also works in a shrimp farm. 

The family is requesting the loan to hire five men for ten days to clean their cacao farm. Cleaning is the process of clearing the underbrush in the cacao field and its surroundings to clear access for pruning, harvesting or planting alongside them. Because of ample growth in the lush tropical lowlands of Belize, cleaning is an especially strenuous activity that needs to be repeated every three months.

loans.use: To clean two acres of cacao

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora is a 48-year-old entrepreneur. She has three children, whose ages are 17, 15 and 9 years old. All of them are attending school. Debora is running a pig breeding business to help her husband produce more income. She usually buys and fattens the piglets for six months, then sells them directly to her regulars. At the moment, Debora dreams of enlarging her business but she has limited capital to do so. Therefore, she went to a TLM branch office and applied for a loan of around 4,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). This loan will help her to purchase five boxes of chicks and the fodder. Debora is hoping that this loan will help her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of chicks and the fodder.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 46 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, es madre de dos hijas a quienes crió y educó sola ya que desde hace varios años se encuentra divorciada, ella vive en su casa propia y trabaja mucho pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.El trabajo de Doris consiste en la venta de ropas usadas. Su labor empieza con la compra de las prendas a distintas personas o en el mercado de la ciudad, selecciona las que están en mejor estado, luego divide las prendas femeninas y masculinas y finalmente distribuye aquellas que son de niños y adultos. Semanalmente se traslada en compañía de una amiga hacia los caseríos y centros poblados para vender su mercadería. Lleva en este negocio más de 13 años y le va muy bien. Además tiene  una pequeña bodega en donde vende frutas, bebidas y golosinas entre sus vecinos , lugar en donde atienden sus hijas.Le gusta su trabajo porque puede viajar por distintos lugares , considera que lo más difícil es tener que salir muy temprano ya que a veces es peligroso. Recuerda que se inició con éste negocio debido a los bajos ingresos que había en su hogar , pero desde que empezó a trabajar con la venta de ropa usada , las cosas mejoraron mucho. Ahora también vende algunas veces prendas nuevas que le envían de otra ciudad y espera seguir en ese camino para mejorar sus ingresos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles, agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará mas ropa para seguir con su negocio de venta por los pueblos alejados de su región.
texts.en:
46 year old Doris is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is the mother of two children who she has raised and educated alone as she has been divorced for some time. She lives in her own home and works a lot as she wants to offer her children a better quality of life. Doris works selling used second hand clothes. Her work begins with buying articles of clothing from various people or in the city market, selecting those that are in the best condition. Later, she divides these into women's clothes and men's clothes, and, finally, she separates the children's clothes from the adult's clothes. 
Once a month, she travels with a friend to the villages and population centers to sell her merchandise. She has been running this business for 13 years and it is doing very well. In addition, she has a small grocery store where she sells fruits, drinks, and candies to her neighbors from the place where she looks after her children. She likes her work because she can travel to different places. She thinks that the most difficult thing is that she has to go out very early in the morning and it can be dangerous at that time. She remembers that she began this business because of the low income her household had. But, once she started selling used clothes, things improved a lot. Now, she also sometimes sells new clothes that she buys from another city and she hopes to continue with this new line in order to improve her profits. At this time, she is requesting $775. She is grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible as she feels secure in growing her business. She will used the requested funds to buy more clothes so she can continue her business selling clothes to the distant towns of her region.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena, age 44, operates a general store business to earn an income. She lives with her husband and child in San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Lucena has been a member of PMPC for almost nine years. She has requested a loan in order to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar. 
 
In the future, Lucena hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar

loans.name: Dzidza's Group

texts.en: Dzidza is a forty-year-old mother of seven children. She cooks for local restaurants and schools in the community, but faces the challenge of unpaid bills by customers granted credit. Her husband is a mason, and they are currently sending six of their children to school. Dzidza says, "I decided to join KOMAZA because  I can see my neighbors' trees grow fast and I will get money from the trees." She plans to use the profits from her KOMAZA tree farm to educate her children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 56 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Candelaria has a general store and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar.

Candelaria has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Candelaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar.

loans.name: Sarlintje

texts.en:
Sarlintje is a 43-year-old woman and is married to Marthen, a 56 years old man. They are blessed with 2 children Ari, 18, who attends the 3rd grade of senior high school and Sisca, 8, who attends the 2nd grade of elementary school. Even though Sarlintje’s husband has a permanent job, the income does not fully cover all the living expenses including the children’s school fees. This is the reason why Sarlintje started a kiosk business several years ago. Sarlintje is grateful because the business is running well and she has quite good customers.

Lately, Sarlintje has been thinking of renovating her kiosk building as well as adding more goods. To implement her dream, Sarlintje requested a loan from TLM of IDR 10,000,000. This loan will help her to provide building materials and also kiosk stocks such as sugar, coffee, snacks, soft drinks, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles etc. Sarlintje is hoping that her dream to improve her business will come true.

loans.use: to provide building materials and also kiosk stocks such as sugar, coffee, snacks, soft drinks, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles etc.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida  is married  with one child. She is 34 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Loida is engaged in a general store business to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of Php 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt and vinegar. 

Loida has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Loida hopes to have more savings to support her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt and vinegar

loans.name: Sobeida

texts.es:
Sobeida, de 44 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos , ella vive junto a su esposo en la casa de material noble que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Sobeida consiste en la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir, tiene instalado un taller en su hogar. Se inició comprando una máquina de coser y algunos materiales necesarios para realizar las prendas. Lleva ya casi 20 años en ésta actividad y le va muy bien ya que le genera buenas ganancias.
Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar su creatividad en las prendas que elabora, le agrada ver la satisfacción de sus clientes al recibir la vestimenta en perfecto estado y  además de eso le agrada los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo ya que le ayuda mucho a solventar los gastos que se presentan a diario en su hogar, espera incrementar su producción y continuar trabajando como hasta ahora.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles con el cual comprará todos los materiales que necesita para confeccionar sus prendas y sábanas que pone a la venta como hilos, elásticos, blondas y telas a su vez  está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
44 year old Sobeida is married and has 2 children. She lives with her husband in a house made of new materials that they built with much effort. Sobeida works making and mending clothes and has a workshop in her home. She began by buying a sewing machine and some materials that she needed to make the clothes. She has been doing this for almost 20 years and is doing very well as she generates good profits. 
What she likes most about her work is that she can put her creativity in to the clothes that she makes. She likes to see her customers' satisfaction when their clothes are exactly right and she is also grateful for the income that she makes from her work as it helps her a lot to cover daily expenses of her home. She hopes to increase her production and continue working as she has been. At this moment, she is requesting $400 to buy all the materials that she needs to make the clothes and sheets that she sells, for instance: thread, elastic, and fabric. For her part, she is very happy to know that she has financial support as this makes her feel more secure in continuing her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 36-year-old business lady. She is married to Justine who is a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 28,000 which she uses to sustain her family.

Faith is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase sugar, stationery and flour for her shop.
With the anticipated profits from the business she will save with KADET LTD for future purposes. Her hope and dream is to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, stationery and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace, 35 years old, is married to Allan. She is engaged in selling different products like shoes, polo shirts and shorts. She is a very hardworking mother of five children. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine peso to buy shoes, lotion, umbrellas and clothes for her business. She hopes someday she can have her own store in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy shoes, lotion, umbrellas and clothes for her business

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is married with 7 children. Josie is 50 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, ORoquieta City Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Josie sells different types of snacks to earn a living and has done this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Josie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Josie hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla is widowed with six children. She is 67 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Luzvilla has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos. Luzvilla has requested a loan to purchase feed for the pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Luzvilla hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 40 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Lorna has a junk shop business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional scrap metals, plastics and bottles for resale. 

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap metals, plastics and bottles

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles, 36 years old with two children, lives in the small community of San Pablo, province of Isabela. She has managed a store for three years. Angeles requesting a loan amounting to Php 5,000 to buy canned goods, snack foods, noodles and drinks for her store. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand so that she can cover all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, noodles and drinks for her store

loans.name: Rosienel

texts.en:
Rosienel is married with three children. She is 37 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Rosienel has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs for her hog fattening business. Rosienel has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Rosienel hopes to have more savings for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets for her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. He has 4 children and has been farming for 13 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is poultry keeping and feeding poultry. His biggest challenges are poultry diseases and expensive poultry feeds. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Lelmet and Mrembo. He will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

Leonard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied it is because they gives loans to small scale farmers at a lower interest rate.  He was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  He answered he learned that they are short term loans.

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit your family Leonard replied that he will get income to be able to educate and feed my children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Leonard owns the following a cow, poultry, and bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds to earn income for his children's school fees.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in selling firewood and charcoal. Angelita is asking for a loan to buy more firewood for charcoal and to buy food for consumption. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her business and eventually her income.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to produce charcoal and to buy food for consumption.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus, age 57, is a farmer. For additional income, he operates a kiosk in his neighborhood, where he sells basic goods. He has been engaged in both ventures for the past eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Festus lives with his wife Anna, age 53, in Kakamega. They have three children, ages 14, 17, and 23.

Festus is requesting his third loan with KADET Ltd, after having successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use his loan funds to purchase fertilizers for his farm and to add more stock to his kiosk, buying items like cooking fat, washing detergents, and soft drinks to offer for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business.

He has a dream of becoming a successful businessman in his location.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm and to add more stock to his kiosk, such as cooking fat, washing detergents, and soft drinks

loans.name: Miguela's Group

texts.en:
Miguela is 60 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 7 children.
Miguela has a retail store and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her party supply store such as party hats and party toys.
Miguela has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Miguela hopes to expand her business. Miguela is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her party supply store such as party hat and party toys.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. He has nine children and has been doing this work for 11 years.  His primary income sources are milk, crops, employer pension, and personal business. He will use the loan requested to buy and insure a dairy cow.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding dairy cows so as to produce more milk'. His biggest challenges are: 'Water, diseases and dairy feeds during dry seasons.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Grace, Mama Safi and Maayi.'

David was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because Juhudi Kilimo finances farmers and being a farmer, I found Juhudi able to finance my farming activities.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Importance of using loans for the intended projects.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', David replied, 'I will be able to educate my grandchildren, provide my family with good health care, and also feed my family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, sewing machine' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Christia

texts.en:
This is Christia, 62, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, self employed, and mother to her children. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Christia operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers and sell them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Christia dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a happy family and good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week. The is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of liquefied petroleum gas tanks to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sinza E Group

texts.en:
Rahimu has been a taxi driver for the past 13 years. He works from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. and is able to make a good profit each month. He is in his early forties and he lives with his wife and two children, both of whom attend school.

This will be Rahimu's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy his own taxi, and he used his profits to buy a flat-screen TV for his family, a sofa set and fan for the household, and school fees for his children, as well as covering household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. His dream is eventually to be able to own more cars so as to expand his business.

He will use this loan to open a retail shop business for his wife, where she will sell a variety of consumer items, such as cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour. 

Rahimu will share this loan with his loan group "Sinza E," which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a retail shop business for his wife, where she will sell a variety of consumer items, such as cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Graceis is 33 years old and lives in Langcangan, ORoquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
Mary Grace has a retail business (dried fish) and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase dried fish for her business.
Mary Grace has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 23-year-old married man. He describes himself as responsible and a go-getter man. He owns a motorcycle and provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that he will have children and educate them in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is a married man, aged  27 years old, and has no children yet.  His main business is a motorcycle spares shop  in Kapsabet town and it has been in operation for a period of four years, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

He is taking out his second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase motorcycle spare parts, i.e., bearings, tubes and reams  for resale.  

The anticipated amounts will be used to plough back into the business.  His dream is to prosper in business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Carlos Adán

texts.es:
Don Carlos reside  en  Catarina también llamada pueblos blancos, municipio del departamento de Masaya,  lugar   poseedor de unos de los miradores más bellos de Nicaragua, y de una gran variedad de artesanía, rica en sus productos elaborados por ellos mismo.
 
Carlos es casado, su núcleo familiar lo compone su esposa y dos hijos, tiene la edad de 52 años. 

Posee su negocio propio, el cual  consiste en un vivero, llamado también jardinería. 

Desde hace 25 años es propietario de su propio medio de trabajo, la experiencia que ha obtenido en todos estos años, le ha ayudado a mantener frondos toda las plantas y flores que el cuida diariamente, y que también trabaja  con sus dos hijos que le ayudan a mantener las plantas frescas y limpias entre los que mencionamos jazmines, rosas, veraneras, plantas variadas, entre otros. 

Su negocio le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia y actualmente todos sus esfuerzos están concentrados en uno de sus hijos que esta estudiando una carrera universitaria y uno de sus sueños mas queridos es verlo realizado en un  profesional. 
 
Sus clientes son  turistas extranjeros y personas que visitan de los diferentes departamentos del país, como san Juan del sur y clientes fijos que son casi de la zona.

Esta solicitando un financiamiento  para la compra de plantas veraneras, clavellinas, mil flores, liria, cactus, hortansia, palmeras robeliana, coludos, araucarias grande, araucarias pequeño y abono orgánico.

El propósito de la inversión es tener variedad de plantas para sus clientes mas frecuentes.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Catarina, also known as the white towns, in Masaya department, which has one of the most spectacular viewpoints in Nicaragua, along with a great variety of handicrafts made in the area. Carlos, 52,  is married, and his family comprises his wife and two children. He has run his own business, a nursery, for 25 years. The valuable experience he has garnered over the years has helped him keep all the plants and flowers he cares for healthy. His two children also help maintain the plants, which include jasmine, roses, and bougainvilla.

His business has let him provide for his family. All his effort is currently focused on one son who is in college; one of his dreams is to see his son become a professional. 

His customers are foreigners, people from other departments in the country such as San Juan del Sur, and loyal locals. He is applying for a loan to buy bougainvilla, clavellinas, multi-flowers, water lilies, cactus, hydrangea, palms, robeliana, coludos, monkey-puzzle trees, and organic fertilizer. The investment will allow him to stock a variety of plants so that his customers will visit more often.

loans.use: to buy bougainvilla, clavellinas, multi-flowers, water lilies, cactus, hydrangea, palms, robeliana, coludos, monkey-puzzle trees, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 23, operates a motorcycle, providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes himself as a focused, visionary, and determined man. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. David is not yet married.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of Kes 20,000 to supplement money he has saved in order to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own two more motorcycles within five years. He hopes someday to get married and have children, and he wants to be able to offer them a quality education.
 
This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Tessie has a general store business. She has had this business for four years. Tessie has been a member of PMPC for one year. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store business such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt and vinegar.

In the future, Tessie hopes to have an extra income source for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store business such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt and vinegar.

loans.name: Guljamal

texts.en:
Guljamal is a 61-year-old widow. She lives alone in Marneuli district. The only income for Guljamal is her pension, which is a very small amount. She has nobody to look after her. Guljamal has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for her business start-up without any success. Her loan requests have been rejected all the time because of her low income and poor living conditions. According to Credo estimations, she belongs in the subsistence poor category.

Guljamal requested a loan to start up her own business, which is opening a tea room. Guljamal has already bought all the needed equipment and now she needs a loan to buy raw materials. When Guljamal opens her tea room, she will have a lot of customers seeing as there is no other such place in her area. This business initiative will increase her monthly income and she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Guljamal's loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

loans.use: to buy materials for starting up a tea room

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: A very hardworking and loving mother, Visitacion, 47 years old, is married with four children. She manages a hog raising business. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed and additional pigs for her business. In the future, Visitacion hopes that she can build a large piggery so that she can provide for all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs for her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with 3 children. She is 33 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Anita sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 7000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 9000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents and other items for her general store business.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Anita hope to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents and other items for her general store business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 65 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Evelyn has a store that sells charcoal products. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to start up another business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Yvoty Group

texts.es:
Yvoty es el grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, que está integrado por 12 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que pese a los problemas están saliendo adelante y luchan por sus familias.
Una de las miembros, la Sra. Adriana, quien se dedica a la venta de carbón, ella comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que la venta de carbón esta cada vez creciendo ya que es más barato. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma tener los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carbón en cantidad, ya que de esa forma podrá cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes y tener un buen stock de su producto.
texts.en: Yvoty, a communal bank in Caacupé, comprises 12 hardworking and enterprising women who, despite problems, are getting ahead and striving for their families. Adriana, one of the members, sells charcoal. She says the business is going well and growing because charcoal is very cheap. Her goal is to keep working to have the means to support her family. She is applying for a loan to buy a large quantity of charcoal to fill an order and to have plenty of inventory on hand.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una de las miembros quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, para poder luchar por sus familias y salir adelante.
La sra. Virginia es Comerciante,  esta casada con el señor Leo y tiene 1 hijo. Ella se dedica a las ventas en general de cosmeticos, Ropa, Zapatos, etc. Virginia  tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas y zapatos, ya que por medio de esto podrá seguir con sus ventas y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The original contact for this communal bank was one of the members, who invited her friends to form a group and join the women's entrepreneur program so that they could support and strive for their families. Virginia is a merchant, is married to Leo, and has a son. She sells cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other items.

Virginia's goal is to grow her business and improve her family's quality of life. She is applying for a loan to buy clothing and shoes so that she can keep selling and growing as a small business owner.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia, de 50 años esta casada y  tiene 3 hijas ,con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo al que se dedica Nimia es la venta de comida rápida y lo complementa con la venta de bebidas heladas. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano para  dirigirse al mercado de la ciudad en busca del mejor pollo fresco. Durante el día prepara todo lo que pondrá a la venta por las noches ya sea salchipapas, ensaladas, papas fritas, entre otros. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede hacerlo a lado de sus hijas y así enseñarles el valor del trabajo honrado , siente que su negocio es muy rentable ya que vende un mínimo de cinco pollos al día y esto le genera la posibilidad de ayudar económicamente a su familia, empezó a trabajar con muchas ganas y logró aprender todo lo necesario para que su negocio logre consolidarse, le gustaría mejorar la infraestructura de su establecimiento para atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 700 soles para la compra de ingredientes e insumos tales como pollo , papa , aceite , entre otros , para asi poder continuar con su trabajo ,a su vez agradece el apoyo que le brindan para continuar tras sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nimia is 50 years old and married with 3 daughters. They live together in their own home. Nimia cooks fast food and pairs the food with frozen drinks. Every day she wakes up very early to set off for the market in search of the freshest chicken. During the day, she prepares everything that she will sell in the evening. She sells salchipapas [French fries with sausage], salads, and French fries, among other foods. 

She has had this business for three years and enjoys the work since she can do it alongside her daughters and teach them the value of honest work. She feels that her business is successful since she sells a minimum of five chickens a day, and because her business allows her to support her family economically. She started her work with a strong of desire to succeed and was able to learn everything she needed to establish her business. She would like to improve the infrastructure in her establishment to make her customers more comfortable. 

In this opportunity, she is requesting 700 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to purchase ingredients and supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and oil to be able to continue with her work. She is thankful for the support provided to continue towards her goals. She also commits once again to make the payments on her loan.

loans.use: purchase ingredients and supplies for cooking

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 51-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 20 and 25 years old. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Dorcas will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy clothes materials for making new dresses, blouses and suits to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.
