She hopes that she will educate her children in the future with the profits generated from her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Ltd.

loans.use: to buy clothes materials for her tailoring retail store

loans.name: Zorsan

texts.en:
Zorsan is a 30-year-old man who is married to Wilhelmina, a 26-year-old woman. They have been blessed with a 3-year-old daughter named Aurel. Zorsan has been running a minivan business since 2010. Prior to engaging in this business, Zorsan used to work as minivan driver for two years. Zorsan then spent his savings to purchase a minivan to help him generate more income. 

Zorsan usually operates his minivan business from 6 am to 7 pm. He parks his minivan in front of a building materials store, seeking customers hauling building materials. Recently, Zorsan wanted to buy a second-hand minivan which can help him to generate more income. He plans to recruits a driver and operate the minivan to haul passengers from one to another village. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM of around IDR 10,000,000. He is hoping that his dream will come true, thanks to the loan assistance provided by TLM.

loans.use: to buy a second hand minivan

loans.name: Elvie Goup Group

texts.en:
Elvie is married with seven children. She is 54 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Elvie sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Elvie hopes to save for emergencies.

Elvie is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna, 47 years old, is married with three grown-up children. She has been engaged in a transportation business for five years. She is requesting a loan of Php 11,000 to buy a spare tire and she will use some of her loan for buying gasoline for her vehicle. She dreams that she can buy another vehicle for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. He has been doing this work for 28 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He has seven children.

When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, he replied, "Feeding dairy cows!" He names diseases as his biggest business challenge is. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Maua."

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, and he answered, "Because it finances and gives loans to farmers at a lower interest rate as compared to other MFIs, which do not deal with asset financing." He learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session that the loans offered "are short term loans for small scale farming and businesses."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?", Paul replied, "Money from the sale of milk will help supplement my other income so that I can pay school fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul stated that he owns "cow, poultry, bicycle" but does not own "pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD" but does not have "solar power, running water, sewing machine."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
San Francisco es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, tiene 18 miembros, donde todas ellas son mujeres madres de familia que luchan por dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La sra. Lilian es maestra (vendedora ambulante) y también tiene en su casa trabajos por computadora y fotocopiadora la cual la atienden sus hijos, esta casada con el señor Vicente, tiene  3 hijos, pequeños aun en edad escolar.
Ella solicita el crédito  para la compra de hojas, tinta, mantenimiento de la maquina, etc,.espera seguir siempre bien en su trabajo y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para poder ser personas de bien y útiles para la sociedad.
texts.en:
San Francisco is a communal bank in Luque that has 18 members. All the women are mothers who strive to give their families the things the women themselves did not have. Lilian is a teacher and street vendor. She also offers computers to rent and copy service in her house, a business her children manage. She is married to Vicente and has three children who are students. 

Lilian is applying for a loan to buy paper and ink and to maintain her equipment. She expects her business to continue to be successful, and she hopes her children keep studying and become good and useful members of society.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink and to maintain her equipment.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Blas  está en su ciclo número 20º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 persona se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados,  y con esto está saliendo adelante  y trata de dar lo mejor a su familia y evitar que pasen necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropa y calzados de temporada lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Blas is in its 20th loan cycle with the women's program, in which all the members work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty reduction survey, and one person lives below the poverty line.

Maria, one of the members, was living at poverty level one, according to the last survey. She sells clothing and shoes, a business which helps her give her family the best so that it doesn't go without basic items like she did. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal clothing and shoes, which will help her firm up her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 63-year-old lady from Vihiga in Kakamega County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow and supports a family of five people.

Alice has been selling  various types of vegetables and fruits to her customers. She serviced her first loan well. She makes a monthly income of KES. 5,000, and she is now taking out her second loan which she will use to purchase vegetables, onions and tomatoes for sale. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. He dreams is to run a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre El Amanecer, han asumido el compromiso de mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto  mutuo, actualmente se encuentran en el octavo Ciclo, integrada por 12 mujeres.
Eugenia, una miembro del grupo, trabaja en las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos. Ella tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar para poder apoyar a su familia.
Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de verduras, fideos, arroz, carnes y demás para poder seguir dando la variedad a sus clientes y de esa forma seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda.
texts.en:
The committee is called El Amanecer, they have assumed the commitment to maintain the unity of the group and to work under a framework of mutual respect. They are now in the eighth Cycle; made up of 12 women.

Eugenia, a member of the group, works in sales. She has a store well-stocked with all types of products. She really wants to come out ahead and to progress to be able to support her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, noodles, rice, meats and more in order to be able to continue providing variety to her customers and in this way continue working and fulfilling the demands.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, noodles, rice, meats and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Trabajando Juntas" tiene más de 5 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya viene realizando una actividad productiva.
La Sra. Marta es una de las integrantes de éste comité , se unió al comité por la necesidad de tener una forma de ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo , es vendedora ambulante de remedios naturales y también realiza reciclaje de materiales como ser aluminio , plásticos , papel , hierro , etc. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de aluminio, plásticos y papel, los cuales revenderá para poder tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Trabajando Juntas" (Women Working Together) formed five years ago and works with Fundación Paraguaya. Most of the members are working at the moment. Marta, one of the members, joined the group because she needed work to help her family out. She sells herbal remedies as a street vendor and also collects recyclables such as aluminum, plastic, paper, and iron.

Marta hopes her children have a brighter future, so she works hard every day to give them the chance to go to school and achieve a better life. She is applying for a loan to buy aluminum, plastics, and paper to resell and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, plastics, and paper to resell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 24-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Nada, a beautiful young woman. They have only one small child.  Hasan wants to offer his family a respectable life. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. He has been working as a plumber for a few years. He’s very honest with his customers, and as a result they are loyal to him. His wife supports him in order to bring additional income to the family. Hasan is asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Vitas S.A.L. to renew his plumbing tools. This is his second Kiva loan, and he believes that it will allow him to start his new project properly. Hasan hopes to collect higher revenues and offer his family a very comfortable life.

loans.use: to renew his plumbing tools

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: Florence is a 42-year-old mother of six and a businesswoman. She buys and sells sisal; her husband is a dryland farmer. Her trade business faces the challenge of price fluctuations at the market due to varying demand, and sometimes she has to sell her sisal for no profit. Florence says, "My favorite part of KOMAZA is how the future appears promising because the trees grow very fast." With the proceeds from her KOMAZA tree farm, she plans to pay her children's education fees and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and maintenance

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en: Halima is a 31-year-old dryland farmer and mother of two; her husband is a mason. Halima's agricultural business faces the challenge of drought, resulting in poor harvests. Halima is interested in the KOMAZA microforestry program because it provides a market for the trees she will grow. She says, "The fact that KOMAZA will sell these trees made me join the program." With the profits from her tree farm, Halima plans to educate her children, provide her family's daily needs (such as food), and purchase a plot of land to build rental houses.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: 3.9.235.14.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Quế operates a food stall where she sells fruit. Quế has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Quế is 45 years old, and she is married with 2 children. One of her child is grown so Quế supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Quế joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 previous loans. She is the group leader of the 3.9.235.14.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

Quế hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Pedrozeñas Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes cuentan con actividades  variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerzan al máximo por salir adelante y ser un grupo consolidado y unido.
Cynthia es parte de este grupo, y se dedica a la venta de joyas, comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil empezar, pero que después ya fue abriéndose camino y hoy en día ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre le hace pedidos y con los cuales ella está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas y de esa forma poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su meta es poder tener una gran joyería y es por eso que esta luchando.
texts.en:
The 16 members have varied activities, each one makes maximum effort to come out ahead and to be an established and united group.

Cynthia is part of this group and she sells jewelry. She says that at the start it was very difficult to begin, but that later the road began opening and nowadays she has a good customer base who always place orders and with which she is growing.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of jewelry and in this way be able to continue investing in her business. Her goal is to be able to have a big jewelry shop and that is why she is fighting.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is 46-year-old married man. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his 41-year-old wife and two children. Bagrat works as a cleaner and his wife works as a cook, so they earn a small amount of monthly salary. The family owns a plot of agricultural land where they grow citrus and vegetables. The harvested products are sold at the local market.  

Bagrat is a very hard-working man, and he has been in this business for 21 years. He requested loans from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Bagrat's current loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions to the rural poor, who are considered “high risk borrowers” and often do not have access to credit products because of their low income. Bagrat has requested a loan to buy a mini bus. He wants to start working on the local bus line, transporting locals from his village to the district. The new business initiative will hopefully increase the family's monthly income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a mini bus so he can work on the local bus line

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 25 years old and married to one lady though they currently do not have any children.

Wilson is a farmer and has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD after paying his previous loans well. He plans to use this amount to buy a cow so that he can be able to increase his dairy produce.

He hopes to buy a plot and a lorry in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: 3.4.236.03.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future. Tâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Tâm is the group leader of the 3.4.236.03.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. Tâm is 49 years old and she is married with 2 children. One of her chilđren is grown up so Tâm supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
In 2009, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 43 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling plastic products such as water Jeri-cans, basins and so on in Malindi where is able to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her fifth loan of 100,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business activities.

Her goal for the future is to own her own depot in the area with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita's business is buy and sell fish in the village. She has been doing this for almost two years. She usually earns about 450 PHP a day. Right now, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP to buy a variety of fish such as milk fish, big heads and tilapia to resell. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish such as milk fish, big heads and tilapia to resell

loans.name: Sihame

texts.en:
Sihame is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four school-aged children. Her husband is the one responsible for everything concerning the family and the children’s study fees. He has been employed since 2002.  

As for Sihame, she started her own business in 2010. She works as a hairdresser and has her own salon where she welcomes customers to provide them with beauty services such as hairdressing, makeup, laser, etc. 

Today, Sihame is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate her salon. She wishes to receive added clients to earn a higher income and be able to expand her business operations the soonest.

loans.use: to renovate her salon.

loans.name: Maksemsius

texts.en:
Maksemsius is a 32-year-old single man. After graduating from university, Maksemsius found it hard to get a proper job. He then initiated a business of selling mobile phone recharges, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone numbers. He has been running the business 4 years. From the business, Maksemsius can provide for himself and his parents as well. 
 
Lately, Maksemsius really wants to renew other stock such as cigarettes, sugar, coffee, tea, milk, etc. In addition, he also wants to sell petrol in front of his business place. He then requested a loan from TLM amounting to 10,000,000 IDR to be spent on kiosk stocks and petrol. Maksemsius believes that the business will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods i.e.cigarettes, sugar, coffee, tea, milk etc. and also petrol.

loans.name: Petronillah

texts.en:
Petronillah is a 27-year-old married woman. She has a child who is two years old. She describes herself to be a social woman. 

Petronillah operates a retail store where she sells items such as soda, maize flour, water, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located at an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Petronillah will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy household items to sell. 

Her business goal is to run a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Additionally, Petronilla does farming, which adds to her business income.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 28-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living alone. 

In 2006, in order to supplement his income, Rabih decided to start his own work as a farmer. His job consists of cultivating fruits and vegetables. He takes good care of his land and always seeks to diversify his harvestings to be able to satisfy his clients’ needs.

Today, Rabih is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase the required agricultural tools and supplies, seeds and fertilizers. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage, which will return to him higher profits. 

In the future, Rabih plans to take more Kiva loans and expand his lands by cultivating a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase the required agricultural tools and supplies, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 38-year-old mother of four children, aged 7, 10, 12, and 15 years. 

Patience sells fruits and vegetables in Kaloleni town. She mostly sells raw bananas, oranges, and mangoes. Vegetables include cabbages and spinach. She has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable, since she has been able to provide for the needs of her family from the income she gets.

Patience is approaching for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy bags of onions, a carton of tomatoes, and bags of potatoes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions, a carton of tomatoes, and bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Makabius

texts.en:
Makabius is a 28-year-old man who is married to Shelistina, a 30-year-old woman. They have a 3-year-old daughter named Rita.  

Prior to engaging in a kiosk business, Makabius worked as a motor taxi driver. He sometimes sells crops in the traditional market to earn extra income. 

The profit from running these businesses has enabled Makabius to initiate a kiosk business. Recently, Makabius experienced little improvement on his kiosk business, and it makes him intend to add more goods and also petrol to meet the needs of his customers. 

Makabius then applied for a loan from TLM for IDR 5,000,000 to be spent on kiosk stock such as instant noodles, coffee, eggs, candies, cigarettes, shampoo, snacks, and also petrol.

loans.use: to buy more kiosk stock such as instant noodles, coffee, eggs, candies, cigarettes, shampoo, snacks, and also petrol.

loans.name: Bezhan

texts.en:
Bezhan is a 36-year-old man who lives in Khelvachauri district. He is married and has three children who are going to school. He also has a 32-year-old sister who lives with their family. 

Bezhan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Bezhan opened a grocery shop recently where he sells different kinds of groceries and is grinding coffee as well. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Bezhan requested a loan for purchasing more stock of groceries, which will help his newly started business to develop. He will reinvest the profit in the same business. This will help him and his family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to add more products to his newly started grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his old motorbike

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 37 years old and is married to Michael. They have three children who are in school.

Victoria is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizer and wheat seedlings. She was introduced to KADET by a Credit Officer.

She hopes to do modern farming and have a better standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To  buy fertilizer and wheat seedlings

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina, 41, is married to Musa, 41. They have been blessed with five children: Alfonso, 15, is attending first grade of senior high school; Axamina, 14, is attending third grade of junior high school; Marthen, 9, is attending fourth grade of elementary school; Febriyanti, 7, is attending first grade of elementary school, and Ninda is 2 years old.

Adelina is running a minivan business.  The income from the business really helps her in covering her family’s living expenses and the school fees of her children. Unfortunately, she could not generate any income during the past four months due to the damage on the minivan’s machine. Adelina really wants to fix the minivan, but she does not have adequate capital to do so. 

Adelina then is requesting an IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to cover the spare parts and the repair cost. The remaining portion of the loan will be used to initiate a home-based kiosk business. Adelina hopes that she can get more income by trying the new business.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the repair cost for the minivan and to initiate a home-based kiosk business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 42 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She is in the agricultural business, farming maize in Kaloleni.

Hadija has approached for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy seedlings and manure as she prepares for the rainy season. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and manure as she prepares for the rainy season.

loans.name: Hildah

texts.en:
Hildah is 30 years old, married to Wycliffe and blessed with three children aged 13, 10 and 8.

She owns a food shop which she has been operating for the last seven years. She comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 59,700, and she is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more beans and vegetables for sale. She will reinvest the anticipated profit back into the business hence expanding her source of income.

Her dream is to have a big and fully stocked shop, and to provide a stable life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 62 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Teresa owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over ten years and earns 16,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Teresa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Sinforoza

texts.en:
Sinforoza, 54, is married with three children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

Sinforoza owns and operates farmland. To earn a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale in her local community. She has been in this business for more than nine years and earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

Since 2008, Sinforoza has been a member of the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. She has now requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through her business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden, 32, is married with three children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates an upholstery business in her local community. She has been in this business for more than six years and earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

Eden joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative in 2011. She has now requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand on the products that she can offer. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand on the products that she can offer

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 31 years old, married, and a mother of two children. For the past seven years, she has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 15,550. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her third loan of KES 60,000. Bilha will use the loan to service and repair her motorbike.

She will use the profits to pay for her children's school fees while continuing to run her business. Bilha's goal for the future is to continue growing her business, so that she can improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To service and repair her motorbike

loans.name: Patrona

texts.en:
Patrona, 42, is married with no children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business, buying and selling in her local community. She has been in her business for more than five years and earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

Patrona joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative in 2011. She has now requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand on the products she can offer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand on the products she can offer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Jocelyn owns and operates a farmland by planting and harvesting bananas to sell to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than five years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. Jocelyn joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marry Grace

texts.en:
Marry Grace, 26, is married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Marry Grace operates a family member's business, which provides transportation services. She has been in the business for over two years and earns 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month.

Marry Grace joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative in 2011. She has now requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair a vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in a transportation services business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 40 year old lady from Kakamega County in the western part of Kenya.  She is married and a mother of two children aged 12 and 15 who are both in school.

Judith sells second hand clothes in the town; she has been doing this business for the last 12 years and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. Her latest loan was repaid on time and she is now taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of clothes for sale. She will reinvest her anticipated profit back into the business to help it grow.

Her dream is to open a big boutique business so as to be able to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel, 38, is married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns 27,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

Richel joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative in 2011. She has now requested a loan of 31,500 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and shampoo. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and shampoo

loans.name: Everlie

texts.en: Everlie, a 41-year-old married mother of two, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where she has owned and operated a general store selling sandals and DVDs for over five years to earn a living. She is now requesting a loan of 14,500PHP to purchase ready-to-wear clothing and accessories. Everlie plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Francisca Catalina

texts.es:
Doña Francisca, nació en la ciudad de Masaya cuna del Folklore Nicaragüense y de artesanos,  casada, con 54 años de edad, de oficio comerciante,  su núcleo familiar es de cuatro, sus hijas (mayores de edad) y su esposo.

 Tiene 5 años de poseer  su propio negocio el cual emprendió con mucho esfuerzo con capital propio, su actividad consiste en un pequeño taller de zapatería y  cuenta con dos trabajadores, para sacar  rápido el producto como es el calzado para damas  que es en el que se  especializa, también posee una pequeña pulpería y venta de comida por la noche estos pequeños negocios lo trabaja con su esposo para poder atenderlos y entre los dos salir adelante, manifiesta que es una persona que le gusta innovar y ganar  siempre su dinero honradamente, ya que eso fue lo que le enseñaron sus padres desde pequeña.

  En estos momentos  necesita invertirle a su negocio  de zapatería, ya que su clientela ha aumentado un poco, por lo que está optando a un financiamiento para la compra de Brasil, espejo, tela, charol negro, galleta, forro fino, pana, hilo fibra, azulón, pega blanca, pega amarilla, suela panel, stay, máxima etc. 

Y de esta manera  poder satisfacer la demanda, las sandalias la comercializa en el mercado municipal de la cuidad y sus otros negocios los atiende en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos de sus barrio.

Hace algunos años fue cliente de la institución y tuvo buen record, hoy nuevamente está optando a un financiamiento para mejorar su situación  tanto económico como familiar.
texts.en: Francisca was born in the town of Masaya, the cradle of Nicaraguan floklore and home to many crafters. She is 54 years old and married, and lives with her two daughters, who are adults, and her husband. She is a merchant by trade. She has had her own business, which she set up with her own money by sparing no effort, for five years. It consists in a small shoemaker's workshop with two employees that makes women's shoes, and in a small grocery shop that sells meals in the evenings. Francisca works both businesses together with her husband in order to improve their lot in life. She says she likes to try out new ideas for her business and to earn her money honestly, since that is how she was brought up. At this juncture, she needs to invest in her workshop, since she is facing an increase in custom. This is why she asks for a loan in order to buy the materials she needs to make shoes: Brazilwood, mirrors, cloth, black varnish, straw soles, fine cloth, velvet, thread, felt, white glue, yellow glue, rubber soles, and others. This will enable her to face demand. She sells sandals at the town market and her grocery shop is located at her home, her customers being mainly neighbours. A few years ago, Francisca took out a loan with the same field partner, which she repaid in due time. She is asking for another loan in order to improve her and her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy the materials she needs to make shoes.

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a 32-year-old married woman. She describes herself as an energetic and humble person with desire to achieve her dreams. She operates a agricultural business of buying and selling farm produce, for example, maize, beans, rice and peas.

She has asked for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy a sack of rice, maize, peas and beans.

She hopes this will help to improve her business as well the living stardards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, maize, peas and beans.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 45 years old and a retired teacher living in Kaloleni, Kenya.  She owns a school. She has employed six teachers and now the first groups of students are in standard eight. She has requested a loan of KSH 20,000 to hire more teachers and ensure effective teaching standards for the candidates preparing for the national exams.
She hopes that this will help improve the school results hence attract more students.

loans.use: to hire more teachers and ensure effective teaching standards within her school.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan in order for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gina hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Belandina

texts.en:
Belandina is a 60 year old married woman. She lives with her husband and their 4 children. Belandina is running a cake selling business within a school’s canteen for the past several months.  She wakes up early in the morning to prepare cakes such as fried banana, fermented soy bean, fried tofu, etc to sell at the school canteen. If all the cakes have sold, Belandina will return home and continue her daily routine.  

Belandina has joined TLM’s lending program for the second time by applying for an IDR 4,500,000 loan for her children’s school fees and to improve her business. She would like to buy more cake ingredients such as: flour, sugar, bananas, frying oil, etc. Belandina is hoping that the business will run well so she can complete the repayment to TLM and to fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: To cover her children's school fees and to to buy more ingredients to make cakes such as: flour, sugar, bananas, frying oil, etc.

loans.name: Leyerlita

texts.en:
This is Leyerlita. She previously received a loan of 10,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the more items she will sell which will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leyerlita dreams that her business will grow bigger and also dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 47-year-old lady. She is married to Ezekiel and they are blessed with seven children, the young one being six years old and in school.

She deals in cereals and has been doing this business for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 5,000. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD and the previous loan was paid back. She will use the loan to increase the quantity of her stock by purchasing more maize, beans and millet.

She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. Her dreams and hopes for her business and her family is to run a successful business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans and millet.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old from Olkalou and is married with six children who are all in school.

Peter has a stone mining business that he has been running for the past six years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy modern mining equipment that will enable him work better.
He hopes to own a pickup in the near future.

loans.use: to buy modern mining equipment.

loans.name: 3.13.242.07.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vụ operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

Vụ is 47 years old and is married with 2 children.
Vụ is the group leader of the 3.13.242.07.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.

Her children are grown up so Vụ supports no dependents with her business in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
In 2011, Vụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vụ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Vụ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.
With her business profits, Vụ hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell at her foodstall.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a 34 year old hard working lady who is married with two children, She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She is married to Jonny who is a farmer and all their children are in school. Her major monthly expenditure is the school fees payment. She has a water selling business where she sells water to the Kaloleni residents. She has requested a loan amounting to ksh.30000 to buy a water tank due to the expanded need for water.

loans.use: to buy a water tank due to expanded need for water.

loans.name: Marguerite Germaine

texts.fr: Germaine st une dame âgée de 49 ans, célibataire et mère de 03 enfants. Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter-resto dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 03 ans environ. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson et des denrées alimentaires  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aussi d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Germaine is a 49-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of three children, all still going to school. For work, she has had a take-out restaurant in a district in the capital for about three years. She benefits from good experience in this domain. But her capital no longer allows her to satisfy all her customers, who are sometimes compelled to turn to the competition. This is due to her meager capital. 

She would like to use this loan to increase the number of cases of beverages and some food items, so as to satisfy customer demand. Her sales will grow as a result, as well as her profits. The revenues generated will enable her to do better in meeting family needs and also to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase a stock of beverages by the case and of foodstuff for her restaurant

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Juana es propietaria de un local de venta de comida y de tortillas ubicada en el mercado municipal de nuestra ciudad de san Rafael del sur, Managua.
Por muchos años se había dedicado a las labores domesticas privadas, sin embargo por iniciativa propia decide poner su propio negocio para contribuir en su desarrollo personal y familiar, mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
Su negocio tiene mayor demanda, por lo que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para atender con calidad en su punto de venta.
Es una madre trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante y ser un agente de cambio en su comunidad y su familia.
texts.en: Juana owns a food and tortilla stand located in the town market of our city, San Rafael del Sur, Managua. For many years, she worked in private domestic service, but through her own initiative, she decided to start her own business to contribute to her personal development and her family's development, improving her children's lives. Her business has greater demand, so she needs more working capital to run her stand in a quality manner. She is a hard-working mother who wants to move forward and be an agent of change in her community and in her family.

loans.use: to buy pork, oil, rice, and corn.

loans.name: Maria Aleen

texts.en:
Avelina is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has had a retail business for over 5 years and earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. 

Avelina joined GDMPC in 2012, and  has now requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar and sticky rice. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar and sticky rice.

loans.name: Elius

texts.en:
Elius is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Kaloleni, Kenya. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells mainly clothes and other general merchandise. He started this business four years ago and has been able to expand his business territory in the market.

He has approached with a loan request amounting to 30,000 Kenyan shillings to restock his shop with bundles of clothes. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to restock his shop with bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 29 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married with two children who are aged 1 and 3 years old.

Annah has a grocery business that she has been doing for the past one year. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more onions and tomatoes to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to buy a rickshaw in the near future.

loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Abahizi Group

texts.fr:
Alexis fait partie du groupe  Abahizi et  habite à  Ngozi. Il a 43 ans et est marié  à Justine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 2 à 5 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (bananes, choux, savon,…) depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (bananes, choux, savon,…), à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait   avoir un grand capital pour augmenter les articles de sa boutique.
texts.en:
Alexis is part of the group Abahizi and lives in Ngozi. He is 43 years old and married to Justine, a farmer. Together they have two children, aged 2 and 5 years old. 

Alexis has been a grocer (bananas, cabbage, soap, …) for five years. 

He is on his second loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many items for his store (bananas, cabbage, soap,…) to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to have a lot of working capital to expand on the items in his store.

loans.use: to purchase many items for her store (bananas, cabbage, soap,…) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es: Marlin, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea de Esparta Atlántida con sus esposo y sus hijos. Marlin anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría y engorde de cerdos y venta de refrescos pero opto por establecer un negocio de venta de comidas y pulpería, este negocio tiene 3 años de experiencia, ella vende pollo frito con tajadas, pastelitos rellenos con carne y tacos. También vende churros, refrescos, pan, y otros productos de abarrotería. Ha decidido obtener este préstamo que es por 18,000 Lempiras con el fin de comprar productos comestibles como granos básicos, arroz, manteca, azúcar, pan, huevos, refrescos, churros, condimentos etc.  Para surtir la pulpería y cubrir los pedidos de los clientes. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y tener bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Marlin, age 38, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and their children in a village in Esparta Atlántida.  Marlin previously raised and fattened pigs and sold soft drinks.  However, she opted to establish a business of selling food and groceries.  

She has three years of experience in this business.  She sells fried chicken with plantains, meat turnovers, and tacos.  She also sells churros, soft drinks, bread, and other grocery products.

She has decided to get this loan for 18,000 lempiras in order to buy food products.  She will buy things like basic grains, rice, shortening, sugar, bread, eggs, soft drinks, churros, and condiments, etc.  She will do this in order to stock the kiosk and to cover the customers' orders.

Her goal is to make the business grow in order to get better income and to have a sense of well-being for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita comprar productos de belleza, ya que el negocio que tenía anteriormente fue retirado por la delincuencia que la asechaba, ella se comprara perfumería, cremas, shampoo, entre otros productos, que es a lo que actualmente se dedica a vender.
Ella comenta su experiencia con otros préstamos anteriores, han sido de mucha utilidad, pero que debido a la delincuencia quebró con sus ventas y tuvo que cerrar el negocio, hoy en día se dedica a vender productos de belleza, para volver  a comenzar en el comercio, ella espera que este reinicio sea exitoso para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en: Claudia has decided to take out a new loan, because she needs to buy beauty products. Her previous business was closed because of the crime that threatened it. She will buy perfume, creams, and shampoo, among other products, which is what she currently works selling. She says that her previous loans have been very helpful, but due to crime, she could not sell and had to close the business. Today she is working selling beauty products in order to start over in her business. She hopes that this new beginning will be successful in order to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and shampoo

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Ana tiene una panadería donde produce una gran variedad de pan como pan simple, empanadas, picos, pan tostado, entre otros.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad comercial y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, oficio que aprendió de una panadería particular.
El producto lo distribuyen en su camioneta en diferentes comunidades de la ciudad de san Rafael del sur, Managua.
Su demanda ha tenido un significativo crecimiento en estos últimos meses, por lo que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para hacer frente a los pedidos de sus clientes, y necesita del apoyo financiero para producir más pan.
Es una persona trabajadora y honesta, y en su negocio genera cuatro empleos directos, beneficiando de igual forma a cuatro familias.
texts.en: Ana has a bakery where she makes a large variety of breads like simple bread, empanadas, picos (a kind of bread made with sugar and soft cheese) and toast, among other things. She has been doing this activity for years and has her husband's support. She learned this trade in a private bakery. They distribute the product in different areas of San Rafael del Sur, Managua, using a truck. In recent months, her demand has increased significantly, which is why she needs more working capital to meet her customers' orders, and financial support to make more bread. She is a hard-working and honest person. She has four direct employees at her business, likewise benefiting four families.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a truckload of plantains and some bananas

loans.name: Lupena

texts.en:
Lupena is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of eight children.

Lupena is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually her harvest.

In the future, Lupena hopes to expand her farming business and save money for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertlizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Pefecta is 66 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Perfecta has a business raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has had her business for over 10 years and earns 8,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old from Nakuru. He is married with two children who are aged 16 and 15 years old.

Joseph has a business selling shoes that he has been running for the past 8 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET, LTD. to enable him to buy more stock of shoes to sell.

He hopes to own rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Handdorj

texts.en:
Handdorj is 71 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Tserensodnom, age 60, is unemployed and stays at home. 

Handdorj has been running his shoe repair business in a rental place since 2000. He is a hardworking, open minded, and diligent man. He has already built a close relationship with customers in the area. He lives far from his workplace and needs 3,500,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce his transportation expense.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce his transportation expense.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: Germaine est une femme de 26 ans célibataire mère d'un enfant de 3 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate, huiles, oignons...)dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter le stock des cajots de tomate, bidons d'huiles pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Germaine is a 26-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of three children. She is a merchant, and for fifteen years, she has been selling staple foods retail (tomatoes, oil, onions, …) at a local market. She has good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her customer base, which she acquired over time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory, since she is compelled to sell all of it in order to get more. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to have more crates of tomatoes and containers of oil for a good inventory. This will enable her to satisfy further the constant customer demand and to avoid shortages. She will save her profits not only for expanding her business but also for meeting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes and oil for her customers

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Françoise est une femme de 41 ans célibataire mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 4 et 25 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, ignames et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 02 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un pick-up des régimes de plantains et bananes pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
.
texts.en:
Françoise is a 41-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of four children, from 4 to 25 years old. She is a merchant, and for two years, she has been selling staple foods retail (cassava, plantains, yams, and fruit) according to the season at a local market. She has good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her customer base, which she acquired over time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory, since she is compelled to sell all of it in order to get more. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to purchase a pick-up truck of plantains and bananas to have a good inventory, thus allowing her to satisfy the constant customer demand and to avoid shortages. She will save her profits not only for expanding her business but also for meeting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a truckload of plantains and bananas

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is 35 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 19,180 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

Celestine was introduced to KADET Ltd. by our credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of 39,000 KES, to buy dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, and water cans for the cows to drink from. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her farming activities.

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, and water cans for the cows to drink from

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This is 47 years old Mahmoud.  He is married and has 3 children aged 19, 20 and 5. He has 2 additional dependents, who lived with him as a sales assistant and to help his wife with the house chores. In 1992, Mahmoud established his brief cases and suit cases business. He began his business because he wants to improve his livelihood. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,520,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He has repaid 3 loans. Mahmoud requires a loan in order to purchase more suit cases for resale. He hopes that this loan will help in increasing and maximizing the profit through proper utilization. In the future, Mahmoud plans to expand and to move to a shop.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy luggage to sell.

loans.name: Mundenye

texts.en:
Mundenye is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. With all her children in school, she finds most of her monthly income is spend on school fees. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store, a business she has been running for six years, in Kaloleni, Kenya, her home town. She has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, soft drinks, cooking oil and spices.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, soft drinks, cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Petrus

texts.en:
Petrus, 31, is married to Elisabeth, 29. They are blessed with three children.

To make a living, Petrus sells vegetables such as squash, mustard, spinach, salty fish, etc. He runs the business besides his house. In order to better meet his family's needs, Petrus intends to initiate a kiosk business at his home based to be operated by his wife but he has very limited capital to make it happen. Petrus went to TLM and proposed a loan of IDR 3,000,000. He would like to buy kiosk stocks such as soap, cooking oil, instant noodles, coffee, tea, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy kiosk stock items such as soap, cooking oil, instant noodles, coffee, tea, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 54-years-old. She is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like pants, towels, blankets, caps and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Zenaida has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, towels, blankets, caps and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata is 40 years old, and married with three children aged 5, 17 and 21.  She lives with her family and also a younger sister whom Isata is helping with her schooling. 

In 2005, Isata set up a business selling plastic wares such as bowls, spoons and dishes. She started the business because she wanted to bring additional income into the household to pay for the education of her children. Her business is in the city center, and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le1,500,000 every month from her business. She would like a loan for Le4,000,000. Isata needs a loan to buy more goods for resale. 

Isata hopes that this loan will her help to improve the business by getting more stock. In the future, Isata wants to expand her business to the outskirt of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic dishes

loans.name: Federica

texts.en:
Federica is 37 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, making and selling native mats, in the Philippines. Federica requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF, to buy materials needed to make native mats.

Federica has been in this business for four years. Federica would like to save enough money in the future, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to weave native mats.

loans.name: Francess

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Francess. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 16 years. In 2010, Francess established her cosmetics, beads, hair and hair products business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband with the home affairs. Her business is located in the outskirts of the town, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 550,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 Le. She has repaid two loans. Francess requires a loan in order to purchase more goods for resale. She hopes that this loan will help to improve the business by getting more stock. In the future, Francess plans to expand her business to the center of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 13 years. In 2005, Fatmata established her Patented Drugs business. She began her business, because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are lactating mothers and pregnant women. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 622,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more drugs for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the stock, and also the profit, of her store. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand in other places. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drugs for her pharmacy store

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 59-year-old married woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has seven grown children. She has been operating a sari-sari or variety store business for 10 years now. Usually, she earns 4,000 PHP a month. This is the source of her income and provides for the rest of the needs of her family.

Rosario is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, milo, milk, noodles, detergents, toiletries, candies, coffee, and spices. These items will help her to earn more profit. Through this loan, she will be able to buy such items and sell it in her store.

In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business and to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, milo, milk, noodles, detergents, toiletries, candies, coffee and spices.

loans.name: Saliadeen

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Saliadeen.  He is married and has four children, aged 10, 8, 7, and 5 years, all of them school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to provide care for his children.

In 2007, Saliadeen established his business, selling clothing and other cloth items, like jeans, polos, undershirts, boxers, school bags, towels, and children’s dresses. He began his business while he attended Arabic school, because of the perception of his father about English education.  He was previously engaged in farming with his father.  When he was fully grown he farmed on his own for two years, and then he used the profits from farming to start selling used clothing, which has now developed into a shop.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,050,000 every month from this business.

Saliadeen would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy jeans, shirts, undershirts, boxers, nappies (diapers), school bags, and towels. In the future, Saliadeen plans to build another house, educate his children and open another shop.  This loan will help to achieve some of his future plans. He is a hard-working and trustworthy business man.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his shop, such as jeans, shirts, undershirts, boxers, nappies (diapers), school bags, and towels.

loans.name: Mbetsa

texts.en:
Mbetsa is 50 years old and married with two children. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She works very hard to provide for her family.
She runs a general store in her town Kaloleni and has requested a loan of KSH 50,000 to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store; oil, wheat and maize flour, sugar, salt and washing materials. She has been in this business for more than four years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store; oil,wheat and maize flour, sugar, salt and washing materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She is married and they have three children who attend school. Her major monthly expenditure is school payments.
Mariam has a grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables at the market. She has a fixed customer base, good income, good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

She requested a loan of KSH 20,000 to buy sacks of vegetables and sacks of potatoes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables and sacks of potatoes for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicines for his pharmacy

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 46-year-old woman and lives in the Mtskheta district. She is married and has two grown children who are unemployed at the moment. Her husband is 50 years old and he works as workman in the capital city and has a small monthly income. Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. She has an empty space in her village and plans to open a grocery shop there. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-starts up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Nana requested a loan for purchasing stocks of groceries which will help her to start her grocery store. She will reinvest the profits into the shop and will keep adding more products. Nana hopes this project will be profitable and it will help her and her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for starting her grocery store.

loans.name: Armando Efrain

texts.es:
El Sr. Armando vive en Guayaquil. El es militar en servicio pasivo luego de salir de las filas del ejército decidió adquirir un negocio propio por lo que se compró un taxi. Esta labor la realiza solo a diario en su taxi.
Teme a la delincuencia ya que los ladrones que se suben al taxi abundan y las zonas en donde trabaja son lugares muy peligrosos.Teme que le vayan hacer algo ya que si al él le sucede algo sus hijos y su esposa se quedarian solos; su familia es su fuerza su aliento para alcanzar lo que quiere.

Está casado su esposa le ayuda en los quehaceres domésticos, tiene tres hijos uno de 6 años, otro de 10 años y el ultimo de 12 años de edad todos juntos estudian en una escuela fiscal. 

Armando desea que sus hijos sigan adelante con sus estudios y que no les haga falta nada. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar uniformes y útiles escolares para sus hijos ya que estan por estar al colegio (en la foto esta Armando, su esposa y sus tres hijos). Y así darles un mejor bienestar de educación social.
texts.en:
Sr. Armando lives in Guayaquil. He was in the military reserves, but later left the service so that he could acquire his own business. Armando bought a taxi and now he works every day by himself.

His main concern is crime since he works in very dangerous places where robbers could climb into his taxi. He is also afraid of his wife and children being able to take care of themselves should something happen to him. However, his family provides him the strength that needs to pursue the goals that he wants to achieve.

Armando is married and his wife helps with the household chores. They have three children (ages 6, 10, and 12), all of whom attend a state school. For this reason, Armando is requesting a loan in order to buy uniforms and school supplies for his children since they are already back in school. (Armando appears in the photo with his wife and three children.) He wants to provide them with a better education.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old with two children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a grocery stall in Kaloleni. She is requesting a loan of KSH 20,000 to purchase more groceries, sacks of potatoes and onions to sell in her store.
She is grateful for the opportunity. She hopes her business will continue improving and soon her family’s living standards will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, sacks of potatoes and onions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emman

texts.en: Emman, 31 years old and single, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where, for over four years, he has owned and operated a motorcycle transport service, earning 25,000 PHP every month. Emman joined GDMPC in 2009  and is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair his bike and purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his bike and purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Fikiria

texts.en:
Fikiria is a 38-year-old lady living in Kaloleni, Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives together with her husband and children, in a house they built six years ago. Her major monthly expenditure is school payments.

She has a charcoal stall, where she sells charcoal and firewood. She has approached Yehu for a loan amounting to KES 20,000, which she will use to buy twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kabba

texts.en: This is 49-year-old Kabba. He is married and has 4 children aged 12, 9, 6 and 4 months old. 3 going to school. In 2010, Kabba established his business selling plastic shoes for men, women and children. He attended school up to Class 5 and dropped out because of poverty. His father took him to a garage to learn vehicle maintenance and upon completion he joined his sister in business. After some years, his sister gave him an amount of money to start his own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 965,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Kabba requires a loan in order to buy assorted plastic shoes and slippers. In the future, Kabba plans to buy a vehicle, build a house, educate his children, open a shop and send his parents to Hajj.  This loan will help to expand his business. He is a hardworking and committed businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for assorted plastic shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Ishmail

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Ishmail.  He is married and has two children, a school-going ten-year-old child and a five-month-old baby. He has three additional dependents, one who is a school-going child he is helping and two who help with domestic work. 

In 2005, Ishmail established his clothing business. After attaining his Ordinary Level education certificate he joined his elder brother in this business. He had wanted to go to college but was not able to for lack of financial support. He and his brother worked in the trade together for years, until Ishmail set up his own business.  

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,100,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ishmail requires a loan in order to purchase jeans, shoes, t-shirts, sneakers, Lacoste shirts, and football jerseys. 

In the future, Ishmail plans to expand his business, set up a cosmetics store and educate his children. He is a hardworking and competitive businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more jeans, shoes, t-shirts and football jerseys

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has five children, aged 21, 20, 18, 15 and 10 years; three are school-going children. In 2002, Ibrahim established his food (rice, onions, sugar, and salt) business. He began his business because he came from a poor background. He was not able to finish his secondary education; he then decided to join his brother who was a trader. They traded from place to place until he set up his own business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 537,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to purchase bags of rice, sugar, salt and onions. In the future, Ibrahim plans to educate his school-going children and develop his business. Competition is his main challenge. The loan will help him achieve his dream because it will enable him to buy more stock for his growing business. He is hardworking and committed to his business. He thanks you for your support.
